definitions: small round fruit that grows in clusters on vines
primary agricultural crop used in winemaking production worldwide
examples: She bought a bunch of grapes from the market
The grapes were sweet and juicy this season
These grapes will produce excellent wine this year
The vineyard harvested grapes for their premium vintage

definitions: large yellow or pink citrus fruit with slightly bitter taste
examples: She had half a grapefruit for breakfast
The pink grapefruit was sweeter than expected

definitions: woody climbing plant that produces grapes for eating or winemaking
informal system of spreading information through social connections and gossip
examples: The grapevine covered the entire garden arbor
They pruned the grapevine for better fruit production
I heard through the grapevine about the promotion
News travels fast through the office grapevine

definitions: diagram showing relationship between quantities using lines or bars
mathematical structure consisting of vertices connected by edges representing relationships
examples: The graph showed sales increasing over three quarters
She plotted the data points on the graph
The computer analyzed the graph for shortest path algorithms
This graph contains seven vertices and twelve edges

definitions: visual design element such as drawing, illustration, or computer image
description or depiction containing vivid and explicit details often disturbing
examples: The website featured colorful graphics and animations
She designed graphics for the marketing campaign
The movie contained graphic violence unsuitable for children
His graphic description of the accident upset listeners

definitions: soft black carbon mineral used in pencils and as industrial lubricant
examples: The pencil contained high-quality graphite for smooth writing
They used graphite as a lubricant in machinery

definitions: hooked device used for gripping or holding things together
close physical struggle or wrestling hold between opponents
examples: The ship used a grapple to retrieve the anchor
The crane's grapple lifted heavy metal scraps
The wrestlers engaged in a fierce grapple
They broke free from the grapple and continued fighting

definitions: act of wrestling or fighting at close quarters with opponent
process of struggling to understand or deal with difficult problem
examples: The grappling match lasted for twenty minutes
Their grappling technique showed years of training
She spent weeks grappling with complex equations
The committee is grappling with budget constraints

definitions: firm hold or grip with the hand
ability to understand or comprehend something intellectually
examples: His grasp on the rope prevented him from falling
The baby's grasp was surprisingly strong
She has a good grasp of quantum physics
His grasp of the situation helped resolve conflicts

definitions: green or brown insect with long hind legs for jumping
examples: The grasshopper jumped through the tall grass
Children caught grasshoppers in the summer meadow

definitions: large open area covered with grass and few trees
examples: The cattle grazed on the vast grassland
Wildlife thrived in the protected grassland habitat

definitions: framework of metal bars used as barrier or drain cover
metal frame holding fuel in fireplace or furnace for burning
examples: The storm drain had a heavy metal grate
They installed a decorative grate over the window
He placed logs on the fireplace grate
The coal burned steadily on the iron grate

definitions: feeling of satisfaction or pleasure from achieving desired outcome
act of satisfying desire or giving pleasure to oneself or others
examples: She felt immediate gratification from helping others
The gratification of completing the project was immense
He sought instant gratification through impulse purchases
Delayed gratification often leads to greater rewards

definitions: framework of parallel or crossed bars used as screen or cover
harsh and irritating quality of sound that causes discomfort
examples: The ventilation system had a protective grating
They walked carefully over the metal floor grating
Her grating voice made everyone uncomfortable
The grating sound of metal on concrete hurt their ears

definitions: quality of being thankful and showing appreciation for kindness received
examples: She expressed deep gratitude for their support
His gratitude was evident in his heartfelt speech

definitions: excavated place in ground where dead body is buried
situation or matter of serious importance requiring urgent attention
examples: They placed flowers on her mother's grave
The cemetery contained hundreds of unmarked graves
The country faces a grave economic crisis
This is a grave matter requiring immediate action

definitions: person whose job is digging graves in cemeteries for burials
examples: The gravedigger prepared the plot for tomorrow's funeral
He worked as a gravedigger at the local cemetery

definitions: loose mixture of small stones used for paths and construction
examples: They spread gravel on the driveway
The gravel crunched under their feet

definitions: stone marker placed at grave site with inscription identifying deceased
examples: The old gravestone was weathered but still readable
They ordered a granite gravestone with her name engraved

definitions: area of land used for burying dead bodies with graves and monuments
place where old or obsolete items are stored or abandoned permanently
examples: The historic graveyard dated back three hundred years
They walked through the graveyard reading old inscriptions
The field became a graveyard for old airplanes
The warehouse was a graveyard of failed products

definitions: natural force of attraction between objects with mass in universe
examples: Newton's law of gravitation explains planetary orbits
Gravitation affects all objects regardless of size

definitions: force that attracts objects toward earth's center or between masses
extreme importance or seriousness of situation requiring careful consideration
examples: Gravity keeps our feet firmly on the ground
The spacecraft escaped Earth's gravity
The gravity of the situation demanded immediate response
He didn't understand the gravity of his actions

definitions: sauce made from meat juices thickened with flour or cornstarch
money or benefit gained easily beyond normal compensation
examples: She poured gravy over the mashed potatoes
The turkey gravy was rich and flavorful
The bonuses were just gravy on top of salary
Any tips he received were pure gravy

definitions: color between black and white lacking brightness or saturation
area of uncertainty between two clear categories or positions
examples: He wore a gray suit to the interview
The sky turned gray before the storm
The legal issue falls into a gray area
There's a gray zone between right and wrong

definitions: slight injury where skin is scraped but not deeply cut
area of land where animals feed on growing grass
examples: The graze on her knee needed cleaning
He got a minor graze from falling
The cattle moved to fresh graze each week
The graze supported fifty head of sheep

definitions: act of animals feeding on grass in fields or pastures
practice of managing land for livestock to feed on vegetation
examples: The sheep spent all day grazing
Grazing helps maintain grassland ecosystems
Rotational grazing improves pasture health
The grazing rights were leased to local farmers

definitions: thick oily substance used to reduce friction in machinery
animal fat or oil used in cooking or accumulated from cooking
examples: He applied grease to the bicycle chain
The mechanic used special grease for bearings
She removed the bacon grease from the pan
The grease splattered while frying chicken

definitions: person who achieved exceptional distinction in their field or era
achievement or accomplishment of exceptional significance and lasting impact
examples: The museum honored the greats of jazz music
She studied the literary greats of the nineteenth century
This discovery ranks among the greats of science
His performance was one of the all-time greats

definitions: intense selfish desire for wealth, power, or material possessions beyond need
examples: Corporate greed led to the financial crisis
His greed destroyed important relationships

definitions: color of grass and leaves between blue and yellow
environmental conservation and sustainability practices or movements
state of being inexperienced or naive in particular area
examples: The green of the forest was vibrant
She painted the walls a soft green
The company invested in green energy solutions
The green movement gained political support
The green recruits needed extensive training
He was still green at negotiating contracts

definitions: informal term for United States paper currency especially dollar bills
examples: He paid with a handful of greenbacks
The greenback strengthened against foreign currencies

definitions: area of open land around city maintained to prevent urban sprawl
examples: The greenbelt preserved farmland near the city
Development was prohibited within the greenbelt

definitions: green plants or foliage used for decoration or covering area
examples: The wedding venue was decorated with lush greenery
Tropical greenery surrounded the resort

definitions: glass or plastic structure for growing plants in controlled conditions
atmospheric phenomenon trapping heat and raising global temperatures
examples: She grew tomatoes year-round in her greenhouse
The commercial greenhouse produced flowers for export
The greenhouse effect contributes to climate change
Scientists studied greenhouse gas emissions

definitions: process of becoming more environmentally conscious and sustainable in practices
natural process of plants or areas becoming green with vegetation
examples: The greening of corporate policies improved sustainability
Urban greening initiatives created more parks
The greening of the desert after rain was remarkable
Spring brings the greening of the landscape

definitions: strip of undeveloped land reserved for recreational use or environmental protection
examples: The greenway connected parks throughout the city
Cyclists enjoyed the scenic riverside greenway

definitions: words or gestures used when meeting or acknowledging someone
message sent to express good wishes on special occasion
examples: Her warm greeting made visitors feel welcome
The traditional greeting involved bowing
She sent greeting cards for the holidays
The greeting expressed congratulations on their wedding

definitions: mythical mischievous creature blamed for unexplained mechanical problems
unexplained malfunction or problem especially in machinery or systems
examples: Stories of gremlins sabotaging aircraft were common
The movie featured cute but destructive gremlins
There's a gremlin in the computer system
Technical gremlins delayed the broadcast

definitions: small bomb thrown by hand or launched mechanically in combat
examples: The soldier threw a grenade into the bunker
Smoke grenades provided cover for the advance

definitions: British spelling of color between black and white
area lacking clear definition or falling between distinct categories
examples: She wore a grey dress to the ceremony
The grey clouds threatened rain
The policy exists in a grey area
There are many grey areas in the regulations

definitions: tall slender dog breed known for racing and hunting speed
intercity bus transportation service company in North America
examples: The greyhound reached speeds of forty miles per hour
Retired racing greyhounds make gentle pets
She took the Greyhound bus to visit family
The Greyhound station was downtown

definitions: pattern of intersecting parallel lines forming squares or rectangles
network of electrical power lines and stations distributing electricity
urban street pattern with perpendicular roads forming rectangular blocks
examples: She drew a grid to organize the data
The map showed a grid of coordinates
The power grid failed during the storm
Solar panels fed electricity into the grid
The city's grid made navigation easy
Manhattan has a famous street grid system

definitions: marked field used for American football with parallel yard lines
framework of metal bars used for grilling food over fire
examples: The teams took the gridiron for kickoff
Rain turned the gridiron into muddy chaos
He cooked steaks on the gridiron
The gridiron left perfect grill marks

definitions: severe traffic congestion where vehicles cannot move in any direction
situation where opposing parties cannot reach agreement preventing progress
examples: Downtown gridlock lasted for three hours
The accident caused complete gridlock
Political gridlock prevented passing new legislation
Budget negotiations ended in gridlock

definitions: intense sorrow especially caused by someone's death or significant loss
examples: Her grief over losing her father was overwhelming
The community shared their grief after the tragedy

definitions: official complaint about unfair treatment requiring resolution through formal process
examples: The union filed a grievance about working conditions
Her grievance was heard by the committee

definitions: legendary creature with eagle's head and wings on lion's body
examples: The griffin guarded the castle entrance
Ancient coins depicted griffins as symbols of power

definitions: metal framework or device for cooking food over open flame
casual restaurant specializing in grilled food and informal dining
protective metal barrier with bars or mesh covering opening
examples: He cleaned the grill before the barbecue
The gas grill heated up quickly
They met at the neighborhood bar and grill
The grill served burgers and steaks
Security grills protected the store windows
The decorative grill covered the air vent

definitions: ornamental metal grating used as screen or protective barrier on vehicles
examples: The car's chrome grille gleamed in sunlight
The radiator grille needed replacement after the accident

definitions: method of cooking food over direct heat on grill
aggressive questioning to obtain information or test knowledge
examples: Grilling vegetables brings out their natural sweetness
Summer grilling is a family tradition
The detective's grilling lasted three hours
She faced tough grilling from the committee
